## Fetch Network Papers from Pubmed

This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see <http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com>.

When you click the **Knit** button a document will be generated that includes both content as well as the output of any embedded R code chunks within the document. You can embed an R code chunk like this:

### Cytoscape
```{r}
library(RISmed)
library(ggplot2)

query_term="cytoscape" # switch this out for any software
res<-EUtilsSummary(query_term,type="esearch",db="pubmed",datetype='pdat',mindate=1996,maxdate=2017,retmax=1000)
QueryCount(res)

# Fetch Year
result<-EUtilsGet(res)
year<-YearPubmed(result) # takes time
year<-na.omit(year)

qplot(year,fill=I('royalblue'),binwidth=0.5,xlab="Year of Publication",ylab="Number of papers",
      main=paste("PubMed Articles containing '",query_term,"'; n=",length(year),sep=""))+
  scale_x_continuous(breaks=seq(1996,2016,1),limits=c(1996,2016.5))+
  theme_bw()+
  geom_text(stat='count',aes(label=..count..),vjust=-0.25)+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
```
